item.title: Heather add a quote by Joseph Addison
item.description: "Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body." -- Joseph Addison

item.title: Heather add a quote by Jawaharlal Nehru
item.description: "Culture is the widening of the mind and of the spirit." -- Jawaharlal Nehru

item.title: Heather add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "What should young people do with their lives today? Many things, obviously. But the most daring thing is to create stable communities in which the terrible disease of loneliness can be cured." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Heather add a quote by Michael Kimmelman
item.description: "[Robert Rauschenberg, 1925-2008] helped to obscure the lines between painting and sculpture, painting and photography, photography and printmaking, sculpture and photography, sculpture and dance, sculpture and technology, technology and performance art — not to mention between art and life." -- Michael Kimmelman

item.title: Heather add a quote by Robert Rauschenberg
item.description: "I usually work in a direction until I know how to do it, then I stop, At the time that I am bored or understand — I use those words interchangeably — another appetite has formed. A lot of people try to think up ideas. I’m not one. I’d rather accept the irresistible possibilities of what I can’t ignore." -- Robert Rauschenberg

item.title: Heather add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Heather add a quote by Clifton Fadiman
item.description: "When you reread a classic you do not see more in the book than you did before; you see more in you than there was before." -- Clifton Fadiman

item.title: Heather add a quote by Stephen Roberts
item.description: "I contend that we are both atheists. I just believe in one fewer god than you do. When you understand why you dismiss all the other possible gods, you will understand why I dismiss yours." -- Stephen Roberts

item.title: Heather add a quote by Thomas Carlyle
item.description: "The best effect of any book is that it excites the reader to self activity." -- Thomas Carlyle

item.title: Heather add a quote by Erica Jong
item.description: "Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn’t." -- Erica Jong

item.title: Heather add a quote by Erica Jong
item.description: "And the trouble is, if you don't risk anything, you risk even more." -- Erica Jong

item.title: Heather add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "It usually takes me two or three days to prepare an impromptu speech." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Heather add a quote by Charles mingus
item.description: " Making the simple complicated is commonplace; making the complicated simple, awesomely simple, that’s creative." -- Charles mingus

item.title: Heather add a quote by Marlene Dietrich
item.description: "I love quotations because it is a joy to find thoughts one might have, beautifully expressed with much authority by someone recognized wiser than oneself." -- Marlene Dietrich

item.title: Heather add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Nothing will work unless you do." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Heather add a quote by William Henry Channing
item.description: "To live content with small means; to seek elegance rather than luxury, and refinement rather than fashion, to be worthy, not respectable, and wealthy, not rich; to study hard, think quietly, talk gently, act frankly, to listen to stars and birds, to babes and sages, with open heart, to bear all cheerfully, to all bravely await occasions, hurry never. In a word, to let the spiritual unbidden and unconscious grow up through the common. This is to be my symphony." -- William Henry Channing

item.title: Heather add a quote by Robert Bringhurst
item.description: "When you think intensely and beautifully, something happens. That something is called poetry. If you think that way and speak at the same time, poetry gets in your mouth. If people hear you, it gets in their ears. If you think that way and write at the same time, then poetry gets written. But poetry exists in any case. The question is only: are you going to take part, and if so, how?" -- Robert Bringhurst

item.title: Heather add a quote by Marcus Garvey
item.description: "If you haven't confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life. With confidence, you have won even before you have started. " -- Marcus Garvey

item.title: Heather add a quote by Washington Irving
item.description: "Great minds have purpose, others have wishes. Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortunes; but great minds rise above them." -- Washington Irving

item.title: Heather add a quote by Ronald B. Kitaj Pop Art Painte 1932-Present
item.description: "Museums are to me lighthouses of utopianism and social well-being." -- Ronald B. Kitaj Pop Art Painte 1932-Present

item.title: Heather add a quote by Robert Bringhurst Poet 1946-Present
item.description: "An artist is anyone who remembers." -- Robert Bringhurst Poet 1946-Present

item.title: Heather add a quote by Frank McCourt
item.description: "He says, you have to study and learn so that you can make up your own mind about history and everything else but you can’t make up an empty mind. Stock your mind, stock your mind. You might be poor, your shoes might be broken, but your mind is a palace." -- Frank McCourt

item.title: Heather add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "Whoever is happy will make others happy." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Heather add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Heather add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Heather add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Heather add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Heather add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Heather add a quote by Art Spiegelman
item.description: "To die, it's easy. But you have to struggle for life." -- Art Spiegelman

item.title: Heather add a quote by Plutarch
item.description: "The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be kindled." -- Plutarch
